definition: bodily fluids (general term in Chinese medicine)
saliva/sweat/a ferry crossing/a ford (river crossing)/abbr. for Tianjin 天津

sentences.english: The occurrence of plaque blood fluid does not stagnate, due to stasis in the upper body.
sentences.chinese: 斑的发生是气血津液不凝滞，郁积在上半身所致。

sentences.english: What's body fluid deficiency, try to narrate its cause and clinical manifestation.
sentences.chinese: 何谓津液不足证？试述其病因及临床表现。

sentences.english: Body fluid which includes blood and Jin-ye is the fluid structure of human being.
sentences.chinese: 体液是人体的流体结构，包括血与津液。

sentences.english: Qi is a sort of refined substance with powerful activity.
sentences.chinese: 气血津液都是维持人体生命活动的基本物质。

sentences.english: Blood and body fluid are liquids and, what's more, they both perform the nourishing and moistening functions.
sentences.chinese: 血和津液都是液体，而且它们都有滋养功能。

sentences.english: So whether body fluid is adequate or inadequate depends upon the conditions of spleen-qi and stomach-qi.
sentences.chinese: 因此，津液的充足与否依赖脾胃之气的状态。

sentences.english: The spleen and stomach play an important role in the production of body fluid.
sentences.chinese: 在生成津液的过程中，脾胃之气起着决定性作用。

sentences.english: Qi cannot exist without body fluid.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有津液，气就无法存在。

sentences.english: The large intestine has close relationship with the brain through body fluid and meridians and collaterals in TCM.
sentences.chinese: 在生理上中医认为大肠与脑通过津液和经络密切相联。

sentences.english: Qi, blood and body fluid are the basic substances for maintaining life activities.
sentences.chinese: 气血津液都是维持人体生命活动的基本物质。

sentences.english: Fourth, body fluid is a carrier of qi.
Sweat pores play an important role in the running of body liquid.
sentences.chinese: 玄府在津液运行中起着重要作用。

sentences.english: Body fluid will become and important component of blood when infiltrating into the blood vessels.
sentences.chinese: 津液进入脉中就会成为血液的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: Dangling dry autumn air, easily injured Jinye, the diet should be Ziyin Runfei suitable.
sentences.chinese: 秋季燥气当令，易伤津液，故饮食应以滋阴润肺为宜。

sentences.english: Body fluids consist of the water of the body and substances dissolved in it.
sentences.chinese: 津液是由身体的水，以及溶质组成的。

definition: spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)
bladder 氣|气[qi4] transformation in TCM
five viscera of TCM, namely: heart 心[xin1], liver 肝[gan1], spleen 脾[pi2], lungs 肺[fei4] and kidneys 腎|肾[shen4]

(TCM) six bowels (hollow organs), namely: gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3], stomach 胃[wei4], large intestine 大腸|大肠[da4 chang2], small intestine 小腸|小肠[xiao3 chang2], triple heater 三焦[san1 jiao1], bladder 膀胱[pang2 guang1]
(TCM) the three truncal cavities (thoracic, abdominal and pelvic), known as the "triple heater" or "San Jiao"
qi and blood (two basic bodily fluids of Chinese medicine)
deficiency of yin 陰|阴[yin1] in TCM
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
condition characterized by thirst, hunger, frequent urination and weight loss, identified in TCM with type 2 diabetes
clotted blood/extravasated blood (leaking into surrounding tissue)/thrombosis
